column1: Weighted MRI size (128, 256, 1) in T2, showing the head of a man of 37 years old, with sagittal section n°105 starting from the right hemisphere of the skull. The image reveals the presence of the white matter of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 5597.7539 mm³, the cortex of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 4707.8613 mm³, the left lateral ventricle of volume 200.3906 mm³, the temporal horn of left lateral ventricle of volume 5.2734 mm³, the white matter of left hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 510.2051 mm³, the left cerebellar cortex of volume 1559.6191 mm³, the left thalamus of volume 174.0234 mm³, the left caudate nucleus of volume 2.6367 mm³, the left putamen of volume 230.7129 mm³, the left globus pallidus of volume 154.2480 mm³, the brainstem of volume 9.2285 mm³, the left hippocampus of volume 166.1133 mm³, the left amygdala of volume 127.8809 mm³ and the left ventral diencephalon of volume 59.3262 mm³.
